content.p: Welcome to our website. This is the homepage where you can find links to various topics we cover.
XML (Extensible Markup Language) is a flexible text format for representing structured data. In this section, we will explore its basic syntax and structure.
HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard language for creating web pages. Here, we'll cover the basic elements and structure of an HTML page.
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and layout web pages. Learn how to change colors, fonts, and positioning in this section.
JavaScript is a scripting language that allows you to create dynamic content on your website. In this section, we will introduce the basics of JavaScript.
Good web design is about creating intuitive, user-friendly websites. This section will discuss key principles of web design such as layout, color, and accessibility.
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is essential for making your website discoverable. In this section, we will discuss the best practices for optimizing your content for search engines.
